item.title: Philippines welcomes 190K Sputnik V second doses
item.description: The Philippines on Saturday evening welcomed 190,000 second doses of the Sputnik V vaccine.

item.title: Drilon urges COA, Ombudsman to probe DBM-PS deals with Pharmally
item.description: Senate Minority Leader Franklin Drilon has urged the Commission on Audit (COA) and the Ombudsman to investigate the allegedly overpriced COVID-19 supplies procured by the Department of Budget and Management-Procurement Service (DBM-PS).

item.title: PFP endorses Bongbong Marcos as their presidential candidate for Eleksyon 2022
item.description: The Partido Federal ng Pilipinas on Saturday endorsed Former Senator Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. as the party s presidential candidate for Eleksyon 2022.

item.title: Hitman daw na sangkot sa mga insidente ng pamamaril sa Calabarzon, huli
item.description: Sa kulungan ang bagsak ng isa umanong hitman matapos niyang barilin ang isang lalaki sa Calamba, Laguna. Ang suspek, sangkot din sa ilang insidente ng pamamaril sa Calabarzon.

item.title: Pateros ties 'yellow ribbon' outside houses of COVID-positive, quarantined contacts
item.description: The Pateros City Government has marked - using yellow ribbons - houses with COVID-19 positive individuals and quarantined close contacts for easier monitoring in an effort to curb the spread of the virus.

item.title: Suspected Calabarzon hitman arrested in Calamba
item.description: Calamba City police officers on Saturday arrested an alleged hitman who was involved in numerous killings.

item.title: Parties welcome postponement of BARMM elections
item.description: The United Bangsamoro Justice Party-Lanao del Sur (UBJP-LDS) and the Lanao del Norte (LDN) on Saturday welcomed the postponement of the first regular elections of the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM).

item.title: Babaeng negosyante, patay nang barilin ng sariling kapatid sa Butuan
item.description: Nasawi ang isang babaeng negosyante matapos siyang barilin sa opisina ng sarili niyang kapatid sa Butuan City. Ang tensyonadong pakikipag-agawan ng baril ng mga pulis sa suspek, nakunan sa video.

item.title: COVID-19 Alert Level 4 over NCR could be extended 2 weeks after September -NTF
item.description: The enforcement of the COVID-19 Alert Level 4 in the National Capital Region could be extended for two more weeks after September if it would result in lower COVID-19 infections, National Task Force (NTF) against COVID-19 spokesperson Restituto Padilla said Saturday.

item.title: US firefighters upbeat in battle to protect world's biggest tree
item.description: Firefighters battling to protect the world's biggest tree from wildfires ravaging the parched United States said Friday they are optimistic it can be saved.

item.title: More hearings needed on overpriced medical goods -Lacson
item.description: More Senate hearings are needed to fully uncover the alleged anomalies behind the supposed overpriced medical supplies procured by the Philippine government, Senator Panfilo Lacson said Saturday.

item.title: UK identifies case of 'mad cow' disease
item.description: British officials have identified a single case of bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE), commonly known as mad cow disease.

item.title: PDP-Laban Pacquiao faction forges alliance with 2 local parties
item.description: Two political parties from the Visayas and Mindanao have signed an alliance with the PDP-Laban faction led by Senator Manny Pacquiao.

item.title: Girls excluded from returning to secondary school in Afghanistan
item.description: Girls were excluded from returning to secondary school in Afghanistan on Saturday, after the country's new Taliban rulers ordered only boys and male teachers back to the classroom.

item.title: PDP-Laban Cusi faction starts issuing nomination certificates
item.description: The PDP-Laban faction led by Energy Secretary Alfonso Cusi on Saturday started to issue Certificate of Nomination and Acceptance (CONA) to its candidates for national and local positions for for the May 2022 polls.
